text: Is there an in-place method for rotl90(A), e.g. there is no rotl90!(A) in the documentation?   Maybe a clever way to do it with mapslice?

text: there's none because `A` may not be square matrix and the algorithms is written generally. (we don't have a type for square matrix)

elements.text: may not be square matrix and the algorithms is written generally. (we don't have a type for square matrix)

text: Aha!  Thanks.   Yes, A is a square matrix, say 2000x2000 of Float64.   So perhaps I can write my own rotr90!(squareA) that allocates no memory and efficiently moves the data.  I'll give that a try.   I'm open to suggestions as to the best ways to do this.

text: Basically you would need to do a cyclic permutation of each four corresponding rotated locations by extracting them all first then putting them all back. There's no reshape here?
